author: aharon
title: ₳GOV: Agreements Building Platform
description: La prise de décision décentralisée nécessite de larges discussions, mais les plateformes utilisées par les membres des DAO ne sont pas adaptées à cet effet.

f6_assessments.q0: Consenz est une plateforme permettant le développement collaboratif de propositions, les modifications étant apportées par des mécanismes de vote continu intégrés à la discussion des modifications individuelles.  Je pense que cela correspond parfaitement à l'objectif du défi, qui est de développer des outils pour gérer les DAO.  Je donne la note la plus élevée pour l'impact parce que je pense que le développement réussi de ce projet peut grandement améliorer la communauté Cardano, à la fois en améliorant le processus Catalyst, ce qui se traduit par une prise de décision meilleure et plus efficace, et en créant des outils qui seront utiles à davantage de projets sur Cardano.  Ce dernier avantage correspond à l'objectif du Challenge, qui est de donner aux créateurs de DAO des raisons de se tourner vers Cardano plutôt que vers d'autres plateformes.  En tant que personne préoccupée depuis quelques années par l'état lamentable du discours et de la prise de décision, et intéressée par les approches technologiques visant à les améliorer, je pense que les avantages du développement et de l'adoption réussis d'outils qui améliorent le discours et la prise de décision pourraient aller bien au-delà des avantages de l'écosystème Cardano, et profiter à la société en général.  Bien entendu, ce merveilleux résultat contribuerait également à faire connaître et adopter Cardano.  La proposition consiste à améliorer l'interface utilisateur et l'ergonomie en s'appuyant sur les enseignements tirés des expériences déjà réalisées avec la version précédente.  Cela inclut la création d'applications mobiles, ce qui améliorerait considérablement l'adoption.  Je me demande si les auteurs de la proposition sont familiers avec loomio.org, qui a une histoire et une éthique assez similaires, et un chevauchement significatif mais pas total en termes d'approche.  Je serais vraiment intéressé d'entendre les réflexions des proposants sur la comparaison entre les deux.
f6_assessments.q1: La proposition vise à améliorer un projet bien établi avec une version déjà existante, et provient de proposants ayant une solide expérience démontrant la capacité des proposants à travailler ensemble et à faire avancer les choses.  Il n'y a aucune indication claire dans la proposition que quelqu'un dans l'équipe a de l'expérience avec les contrats intelligents Cardano, Plutus, etc.  Nous pourrions considérer que ce n'est pas une exigence dans l'immédiat, puisque ce travail est prévu dans la feuille de route pour septembre 2022.  Cela dit, je pense qu'un plan pour une intégration éventuelle avec les contrats intelligents Cardano peut affecter les décisions UI/UX, donc je suggérerais que cela soit au moins considéré dès le début, en faisant appel à quelqu'un avec l'expertise nécessaire au cas où l'équipe ne l'aurait pas.  L'absence de discussion explicite sur cette question est la (seule) raison pour laquelle je ne donne pas la note la plus élevée pour la faisabilité.
f6_assessments.q2: La proposition comprend une feuille de route pour l'année à venir, une ventilation des coûts et quelques mesures clés.  La feuille de route n'est qu'à un niveau élevé, avec quelques mots par trimestre.  Le point concernant le premier trimestre 2022 est en gras et mis en évidence, mais ce que cela indique n'est pas clair.  Je pourrais l'interpréter comme indiquant que cette puce correspond à l'ensemble du champ d'application du financement proposé, ce qui semble à peu près cohérent avec la ventilation des coûts (sauf que ceux-ci incluent les applications mobiles alors que la puce ne mentionne que l'"application Web").  Avec cette interprétation, il semble que les phases ultérieures, y compris la gamification, la délégation et l'intégration de contrats intelligents, seraient hors de portée de cette proposition, et seraient probablement couvertes par des propositions futures.  Cela atténuerait également ma préoccupation ci-dessus quant au fait qu'il n'y a aucune indication d'expérience ou d'expertise autour des contrats intelligents Cardano.  Cependant, cela soulèverait également la question de savoir si Catalyst devrait financer le travail sur un projet qui n'a pas de connexion spécifique à Cardano, même si cela est prévu à l'avenir.  Les paramètres clés me semblent raisonnables en général, mais moins clairement utiles pour rendre compte de cette proposition particulière.  Une des raisons est que les délais associés à chaque mesure clé sont imprécis (par exemple, "après le lancement du MVP", qui n'est pas spécifiquement mentionné dans la feuille de route ou ailleurs, ce qui rend difficile d'évaluer quand cela pourrait être.  D'autres mesures sont également associées à des délais vagues par rapport aux futurs fonds Catalyst (quelle phase/date ?).  Cela dit, ils sont raisonnablement spécifiques et mesurables, et raisonnablement interprétables à des échéances raisonnables.  J'aimerais en savoir plus sur la façon dont les paramètres (exposition et intégration) ont été choisis.  Il est particulièrement curieux que le proposant aspire à ajouter seulement 2 % des électeurs embarqués pendant le Fonds 10.  J'aurais pensé qu'ils espéraient "gagner du terrain", avec une augmentation plus importante.  Malgré toutes ces préoccupations sur la façon dont la proposition est positionnée pour la responsabilité, je donne une note "D'accord" basée sur le fait que les proposants sont bien connus dans l'écosystème, et le fait qu'il y a des artefacts concrets qui peuvent être rapportés et surveillés, même si la proposition ne le précise pas explicitement.

f6_assessments.q0: Proposal addresses the problem of decentralized decision making being hard on current platforms. They will ad value to the Cardano ecosystem by improving the experience on Cardano DAOs. Key metrics of the project is in line with the Challenge setting's as it focuses on exposure to and onboarding of voters. This project is able to scale well as it will eventually integrate with  smart contracts.
f6_assessments.q1: They have provided proof of skills and team for this project with a link to a website of the prototype they built. The budget is a little steep for what is being built especially if they already have a prototype. It is broken down into identifiable items. The timetable provided to finish this is achievable. They already have a prototype of the product that has been used for a while now in other industries, they just need to update it a bit to be more DAO orientated. They explain in detail the different functions of the application but they don't provide any technical details on how it is being built. Providing this info will show voters how you approach this problem and boost confidence in your skills. They haven't considered any risks/ challenges. Not being aware and prepared for future risks can slow your project down.
f6_assessments.q2: They provided a roadmap with quarterly milestones. By the looks of it, it will take 2 quarters to build the MVP. It wouldn't hurt to break up the first 2 quarters of 2022 into more milestones to make tracking the progress easier. The KPIs they provide are measurable and makes it easy to track the performance of this project. They are trying to solve the problem of  decentralized decision making being difficult on current platform. They solve this by creating a decision making tool that integrates continuous voting with discussion features.

f6_assessments.q0: This project could assist in helping developers love DAOs in Cardano. Like someone commented on this project: this project can help other's succeed by providing tools that would help DAOs with discussions and formulating agreements within those DAOs.
f6_assessments.q1: They have been funded before, and so past success can be seen from their previous Fund rounds. I would look to their previous proposals to see if they have fell short, or provided enough KPIs in the past that can show a trend of past success.
f6_assessments.q2: KPIs, since they involve stats on Catalyst, seem easy to access and track. I would want some sort of public counter on a webpage Catalyst members can access to see about their membership in their Consenz website.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal aims to build a platform that allows DAOs to improve decentralized decision-making processes and make them more efficient called consenz. This platform is already under construction. The team is seeking for funds to build an MVP web app. In my opinion this proposal has the potential to help DAOs in their decision-making processes but the description of how the solution will help to achieve the goals of this challenge remains vague. It doesn't really describe if this platform is the missing piece to attract DAOs to Cardano. I rate Impact with 4 starts because of the potential but not higher because the impact remains vague.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer team is skilled about the context and experienced, knows the Cardano community very well because it has already been worked on by fund 4. Although this proposal is well-written in general, the description of the solution is not clear. There is an idea described, but how exactly the solution will look like doesn't appear in detail. Adding content about the structure and processes behind the solution would help to understand the scope of the project.
The proposer team offers a realistic timetable. The budget is explained in detail and looks reasonable from my side. The proposer has not considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful adoption.
f6_assessments.q2: milestones are clear and the KPI metrics are defined with a defined time horizon. The proposal offers a realistic timetable to complete the work. What I miss in this area is that the proposer has not mentioned possible difficulties and how to deal with them (e.g. difficulties in adoption). The proposer has a Github repo but it is not cleary mentioned if the community can audit the progress of the proposal there.

f6_assessments.q0: Relation to personal qualifications: As a year-long activist in both party-politics and non-party related political (grassroots) groups I know how important decentralised communities and governance processes are for democratic and economic empowerment. DAOs are a powerful tool in this respect. I want to bring in my personal knowledge and experience on various governance models into action by assessing proposals in this challenge. With my own experience in trying to organize debates and processes to reach consensus, I can say the proposal clearly identifies a very real governance hurdle which is a viable problem for this challenge to be solved. It clearly articulates a solution that has the potential to add a lot of value to the Cardano ecosystem and DAOs in general. It's set goals align well with the challenge. The way it is described, it becomes clear that it is scalable and builds a good foundation for further topics in this area.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposers are well-known in the Catalyst community and are competent and up to the task. They have already successfully delivered to other proposals and have shown that they are trustworthy and their proposals are deliverable. The proposers are able to show that they know the type and number of team members required to implement the proposal.
The buget is well-defined, fine-grained and rationable. The different parts of the budget are realistic and clearly show where the money goes.
A real bonus is that they already have done a lot of work ahead, so they should have a realistic idea of the amount of work that needs to be done
The milestones are set-out well, comprehensible and detailed and show the proposer has done detailed planning ahead of the proposal. Technical details and a plan for implementation are explained in a comprehensible and cohesive manner, even with some examples. Overall, it is a really great proposal. The only feedback would be that you can also discuss the possible risks and hurdles for the implementation of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: A realisitc roadmap, comprehensible and measurable KPIs and a good description of the problem and itssolution make this a really auditable proposal. Good job, I am looking forward to seeing it implemented.

f6_assessments.q0: "The AGOV: agreement building platform" proposal addresses the challenge of finding better solutions for DAOs in decentralized decision making process.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has started building prototype since 2018 and the proposal is a collaborative effort of previous funded projects along with a software development company. The total budget seems to be channelled towards the MVP webpage app (the initial stage) which raises questions on how many future funding rounds will be needed to see the whole finished product.
f6_assessments.q2: The key metrics are briefly discussed but the risk/  challenges of implementation this voting platform are not mentioned. It will be quite a task for voters to keep track of the project provided that there is a limited info on the budget and how it will be spent.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is about making a decision-making tool that provides a way to create community-driven agreements by integrating continuous voting with discussion features. This is a great and interesting idea. The problem (of Decentralized decision making) is explained in detail with very strong supporting arguments. The proposed solution is very clearly defined, showing a clear impact on the Cardano ecosystem in short term and long term.
Therefore, based on the given information, I strongly agree with this proposal's impact, I would rate it with a score of 5
f6_assessments.q1:
Team profile [from AGOV] is clearly described with the suitable ability for implementation. Besides, this team got the proposal funded in the prior funds. The requested budget is provided with the structure of items but without explanations of calculation base. Risk (and mitigation) is not provided. And the Consez prototype is applied in reality.
Therefore, based on the given information, I  agree with this proposal's feasibility, I can rate it with a score of 4.
f6_assessments.q2:
This proposal provided a wide range of information with reference/proof (documents/links,...) for verifying. However, the requested budget is provided with the structure of items but without explanations of calculation base; so you should consider explaining this. Besides, for better understanding, (1) AGOV team member's profile links should be provided; (2) KPIs (100% measurable but not specific) should be defined in numbers and you should integrate KPIs into the roadmap; this would help the community easier to track this proposal's progress.
Therefore, based on the given information, I am neutral with this proposal's auditability, I can rate it with a score of 3.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal explains how it could add value to the Cardano ecosystem. It also specifically indicates what the problem is that it is trying to solve. The proposal provides concrete examples of how their system of allowing for and scoring discussion works. The proposal claims that a prototype has been built and that they have completed a proof of concept, but I am not sure how to prove this for myself. If we do believe that a smart contract will get enough votes to democratically encourage discussion in drafting a document and that this will be additive to the Cardano platform then this is a solution that could work. It is not clear though that this will yield quantifiable value, if enough quality participation via discussion will occur or that it is better than having one single executor that takes into account comments from other platforms when creating DAOs. Nevertheless, it's an impactful proposal based on the presented materials.
f6_assessments.q1: This is a veteran team with highly relevant and rich experience to carry out the project. The proposer knew, in an identifiable manner, the type and number of team members required to implement the proposal, and was able to propose a clear timeline and reasonable budget for the implementation. Given the evidence, I trust that the team is highly likely successful in implementing it.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer demonstrated a clear understanding of the problem and the solution that addresses it. They also provided a clear explanation of what success would look like and a roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement.

f6_assessments.q0: Making Cardano the go-to choice for DAOs to manage themselves is IMHO the most overlooked and deserving category - DAOs can be the key to many, many proposals that inadequately start(ed) as DeFi, DApp or Governance projects. This is where Cardano's strength lies compared to any other protocol, and we should focus more heavily on *enabling* DAOs to operate effectively, robustly and in a vibrant and democratic way. Consenz fits this brief to a T.
f6_assessments.q1: Strong team and credible roadmap, existing prototype and presentation material look highly professional and give me confidence that the proposal will be carried out in a similarly expert manner. However, the time it took to reach proof-of-concept compares unfavorably with the much more ambitious projection of progress going forward. Also, the budget for Fund-7 does not sufficiently "front-load" necessary further funding requirements, increasing the risk of finalization.
f6_assessments.q2: The lack of risk assessment and relatively slim KPI section do not do justice to the high quality of the proposal and the genius of the idea in itself. I cannot tell from the information provided whether this proposal may require much higher future funding to provide any of the functionality it promises.

f6_assessments.q0: "I highly recommend this idea, to resolve conflicts and create community agreements. Especially with large groups discussing together will often cause distractions that are not focused and difficult to end the problem. There is an issue I don't know if multilingualism will affect the scalability of the proposal. Proposal is suitable for the challenge presented. The team also submitted a ""₳GOV: Policy Registry"" proposal in the ""Nation Building Dapps"" challenge that has a similar solution."
f6_assessments.q1: Proposal team has already demoed in several groups with some content, it will be even better when you add this demo results. Attached documents and arguments examples are easy to understand. The execution, functions and timeline are clear and easy to measure. Team identity beyond the description in the proposal should add Linkedin.
f6_assessments.q2: The quarterly roadmap is clear and reasonable in terms of time, with goals for fund 9.10. Your team has many members with different experience and skills so it would be great to add who handles what and tasks are handled in parallel.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal by Adagov.org is, put simply a web based tool that encourages discource and decision making. The application of this tool is for use within DAO's in answer to the problem of disparate decision making and ideation not meeting discourse. The lack of indepth discussion which is essential for decision making is lost, and the solution proposed is Consenz. This is a decision making tool that provides a way to create community-driven agreemetns through integrating continuous voting with discussion features. As a tool this would ease communication and decision making in DAO's it would put Cardano ahead of other DAO iterations, has golbal relevance and the team behind this would be offering the first version to the Catalyst community and then outward to other DAO's. There's a genuine interest in engaging with the community to address the needs, and the project absolutely has potential to scale and indeed other uses for the tool outside of DAO's.
f6_assessments.q1:
The AdaGov team are part of the Project Catalyst initiative, they reach out to other Catalyst proposers and employing services from sofi.coop to do the development. They have a strong track record and will likely succeed in building this tool - with or without this funding, however, it would be good to ensure Cardano has first access to it. 

The prortotype has been in development since 2018 in the next 3 months they will have at least 5 documents that will be used as guidelines, policy shapers and other purposes that answer community needs. The budget is included and is clearly mapped out. The team are clearly qualified and aligned with the needs of the proposal. 


They plan to Open the code by adding proper documentation and improving accessibility for new developers, and invite the developers community to take part in building and improving the platform.
f6_assessments.q2: The KPI's are very much based on community uptake and engagement and are realistic and measurable targets. There's specific targets for the number of people adopting the technology but there isn't projected number of engagements within the KPI set for engagement, this might be good to consider just so the scope is clear.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is exactly the kind of foundation that we need in DAO's. There are discussions happening that get lost in the ether of the internet so it's difficult to tract how these decisions are made before the votes are made. 

The agreements adds a nice touch because you keep coming back to the same spot to manage your ideas and the idea on the agreement.
f6_assessments.q1: The team is experienced and the mere fact that 3 years have gone into creating a prototype, we can see the experience coming to life already.  The list of needed talents also shows that the team has made it's plans regarding talents.
f6_assessments.q2: There is sufficient information available for an audit. The roadmap, cost breakdown and current status of this project show that it's a self auditing project already. The roadmap is in progress and the dedication of the team is 100%. We can say that the project has gained some traction already. It's only a matter of when and how.

solution: Un outil de prise de décision qui fournit un moyen de créer des accords dirigés par la communauté en intégrant le vote continu avec des fonctionnalités de discussion.
experience: 10 ans d'expérience dans la gouvernance décentralisée. Une équipe qui a construit le prototype de l'application proposée, en partenariat avec ADAgov - Financé F4, F5, F6
